title: End of Enhanced Obamacare Subsidies Puts Tribal Health Lifeline at Risk
summary: Tribal insurance programs give Native Americans access to affordable health care when the Indian Health Service falls short. Those plans are threatened by the expiration of enhanced Affordable Care Act subsidies.

title: New Medicaid Work Rules Likely To Hit Middle-Aged Adults Hard
summary: Republicans have said new rules requiring many Medicaid participants to work 80 hours a month will pinpoint unemployed young people who should have jobs. Policy researchers say the rules are more likely to disrupt coverage for middle-aged adults, harming their physical and financial health.

title: Listen to the Latest ‘KFF Health News Minute’
summary: The "KFF Health News Minute” brings original health care and health policy reporting from our newsroom to the airwaves each week.

title: Obamacare: el impacto de los costos en las inscripciones no se conocerá hasta dentro de varios meses
summary: Los subsidios mejorados, que redujeron el porcentaje del ingreso familiar que se debía pagar por la atención médica y eliminaron el límite de ingresos para calificar, expiraron a fines del año pasado.

title: Trabajadores de salud pública renuncian antes de ir a Guantánamo
summary: Oficiales del Servicio de Salud Pública que trabajaron en Guantánamo el año pasado describieron las condiciones en las que se encontraban los detenidos inmigrantes.

title: La consulta con tu próximo médico de atención primaria podría ser solo virtual y agendada a través de IA
summary: La falta de médicos de atención primaria es un problema nacional. Algunas grandes redes de salud están recurriendo a la inteligencia artificial en busca de soluciones.

title: Obamacare Sign-Ups Drop, but the Extent Won’t Be Clear for Months
summary: Experts say Affordable Care Act sign-up data won’t be clear until people who were enrolled have paid — or haven't paid — their new, often much higher, premiums.

title: US Cancer Institute Studying Ivermectin’s ‘Ability To Kill Cancer Cells’
summary: At a January event organized by allies of health secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr., National Cancer Institute Director Anthony Letai said results may be released “in a few months.” Ivermectin, used to deworm horses and other animals, has become a symbol of resistance against the medical establishment among supporters of Kennedy’s “Make America Healthy Again” agenda and many conservatives.

title: This Ballad Hospital, Flooded by Hurricane Helene, Will Be Rebuilt for $44M in a Flood Plain
summary: Ballad Health, the nation’s largest state-sanctioned hospital monopoly, plans to rebuild Unicoi County Hospital on land that two climate modeling companies say is at risk of flooding.

title: Watch: Is MAHA the New MAGA?
summary: With fractures emerging in the Make America Great Again movement, some Republicans are looking to capitalize on its “MAHA” counterpart ahead of the midterms.
